title: Journal of a tour through the Highlands of Scotland during the summer of MDCCCXXIX.
author: Botfield, Beriah
snippet: Passing PitfourCastle, we surveyed the woody heights which roseon our right above the seats of Glen Doick and GlenCarse, and from the road between Inchary andSeggieden, were most highly gratified by seeing inthe distance to the south the Pictish capital, Abernethy, whose singular circular tower, of the remotest antiquity, our exceUent glass rendered minutely visible.
